metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3372 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
imap/nntpd.c in the NNTP server (nntpd) for Cyrus IMAPd 2.4.x before 2.4.12 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication by sending an AUTHINFO USER command without sending an additional AUTHINFO PASS command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-admin-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl24 - 2.4.16-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd-2.4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16-1').
